options.text: Deciding How to Finalize Your Divorce

A1.text:
Step 1 (Petitioner): Filing for a Divorce/Dissolution/Legal Separation

This is the first step in starting a divorce case. You'll need to fill out and file several forms with the court.

A1a.text:
Step 2: Serving Your Spouse

After filing your forms, you must legally serve your spouse with copies of all filed documents.

A2.text:
Step 1 (Respondent): Responding to a Divorce

If you've been served with divorce papers, you have 30 days to file a response.

Pet_Start.text:
Step 4: Deciding How to Finalize Your Divorce

You have several options for finalizing your divorce case.

A3.text:
Moving Your Case Forward

This involves completing financial disclosures and other required steps.

A5.text:
File an Emergency Request

For urgent matters that require immediate court attention.

A6.text:
File a Request For Order

For requesting court orders on specific issues like custody, support, or property.

end.text:
Process Complete

You have completed the divorce flow. Review your progress and next steps.
